Qwerty
Class LetterBag

java.lang.Object
  Qwerty.LetterBag

public class LetterBag
extends java.lang.Object

This class keeps track of all the Letters that have not been drawn in the game yet and represents a bag in the game of Scrabble. The letter also indicates to the user when the game is over, by indicating it on the draw letter method.

Author:
Abhishek, Jeffrey, Aneesh

Constructor Summary
LetterBag()
          Constructs the LetterBag with all the letters that the game, Qwerty, has at the beginning of a game.
 
Method Summary
 void addToBag(Letter let)
          Adds Letter to the bag, used with the exchange methods in the Players.
 Letter drawLetter()
          Returns a random letter from the bag.
 int remaining()
          Returns how many letters are remaining in the bag, used to display the amount in the message in PlayerControl.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

drawLetter

public Letter drawLetter()
Returns a random letter from the bag.

public int remaining()
Returns how many letters are remaining in the bag, used to display the amount in the message in PlayerControl.
